#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Japan suggests dumping Fukushima waste at sea as radiation hits lethal levels
#Text=Monday , September 2 , 2013
#Text=Radiation at Japan 's damaged Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant yesterday spiked to lethal levels around a leaking tank .
#Text=Today the national Nuclear Regulation Authority ( NRA ) said contaminated water may be pumped into the sea .
#Text=Tanks holding contaminated water at the site continue to leak ; operator Tokyo Electric Power Company ( TEPCO ) says up to 300 metric tons may have leaked from one tank alone .
#Text=Radiation at that tank soared to 1,800 millisieverts per hour yesterday , a rate lethal to an exposed human in about four hours .
#Text=Japanese law says nuclear workers cannot be exposed to more than 50 millisieverts in a year .
#Text=A diagram marking the various points of the power plant where accidents occurred in the wake of the 2011 tsunami .
#Text=Image : Sodacan .
#Text=TEPCO says other locations at the plant have readings of 70 – 230 millisieverts per hour .
#Text=Waste water totalling more than 300,000 tons has already been collected at the site ; more is being stored at a rate of 400 tons per day .
#Text=An unknown quantity of radioactive groundwater is flowing into the sea .
#Text=NRA boss Shinichi Tanaka told a press conference today that stored water may be pumped into the Pacific after treatment to reduce contamination to within legal limits .
#Text=" I 'm afraid that it is unavoidable to dump or release the water into the sea , " he said , adding " careless management " was being applied to the water by TEPCO .

column1: #Text=The situation at Fukushima is changing everyday ...
#Text=The accident has yet to be settled down .
#Text=—
#Text=Shinichi Tanaka
#Text=TEPCO first noticed a leak at the now-deadly tank in July but said it was minor and the NRA gave it a level one " anomaly " rating on the seven-part international scale .
#Text=Last week that was raised to " serious incident " , level three , after TEPCO said up to 300 tons of water had leaked .
#Text=The exact amount is unknown as there is no gauge to measure levels inside the tank and TEPCO staff had said water levels in the tank had remained constant .

#Text=Last week levels under the tank , where lost water is thought to have seeped into the ground , stood at 100 millisieverts per hour , and another at the facility had a level of 70 millisieverts per hour .
#Text=TEPCO found another leak yesterday in a pipe between coolant tanks .
#Text=Highly radioactive material was dripping out , but TEPCO says the leak is now fixed .
#Text=Monitoring at the site has been increased since the original leak 's discovery two weeks ago .
#Text=Around 1,000 tanks are used to store water from the power plant 's coolant system , which was contaminated when three reactors melted down after a tsunami in March 2011 .
#Text=Around 160,000 people were evacuated in the worst nuclear disaster since 1986 .
#Text=Tanaka said " The situation at Fukushima is changing everyday ...
